name: Peter Thiel
lens: Looks for non-obvious truths and asymmetric outcomes.

name: Marc Andreessen
lens: Prioritizes markets where software can redraw the value chain.

name: Bill Gurley
lens: Tests whether growth quality survives under realistic assumptions.

name: Elad Gil
lens: Focuses on speed, market timing, and pragmatic go-to-market leverage.

name: Fred Wilson
lens: Evaluates whether user behavior compounds into durable defensibility.

name: Arjun Sethi
lens: Demands evidence in retention, conversion, and cohort durability.

name: Reid Hoffman
lens: Assesses when speed creates irreversible category leadership.

name: Sam Altman
lens: Rewards bold technical bets with long-term societal upside.

name: Garry Tan
lens: Finds founder-market fit in overlooked, anti-consensus spaces.

name: Naval Ravikant
lens: Frames outcomes through leverage, optionality, and specific knowledge.

name: Paul Graham
lens: Looks for builder intensity and authentic problem obsession.

name: Clayton Christensen
lens: Tests jobs-to-be-done and entrant pathways from underserved segments.

name: Elon Musk
lens: Rebuilds assumptions from fundamentals and physics constraints.

name: Thales Teixeira
lens: Analyzes where customer value is being unbundled and recaptured.

name: Vinod Khosla
lens: Accepts failure distribution in exchange for transformational upside.

name: Michael Moritz
lens: Looks for resilient founders who can execute through volatility.

name: Kirsten Green
lens: Examines cultural pull, repeat behavior, and brand elasticity.

name: Steve Jurvetson
lens: Searches for step-change technologies with nonlinear adoption curves.

name: Arthur Rock
lens: Weights founder integrity and judgment as primary decision criteria.

name: Don Valentine
lens: Starts with demand magnitude and monetization potential.
